entry.et: Italian ombrella, modification of Latin umbella, diminutive of umbra

def.dt: :a collapsible shade for protection against weather consisting of fabric stretched over hinged ribs radiating from a central pole
:a small one for carrying in the hand
:the bell-shaped or saucer-shaped largely gelatinous structure that forms the chief part of the body of most jellyfishes
:something which covers or embraces a broad range of elements or factors decided to expand … by building new colleges under a federation umbrella Diane Ravitch
:to protect, cover, or provide with an umbrella
:a perennial sedge (Cyperus alternifolius) of Madagascar that has large terminal whorls of slender leaves and is often grown as an ornamental
:any of various trees or shrubs resembling an umbrella especially in the arrangement of leaves or the shape of the crown
:a widely cultivated schefflera (Schefflera actinophylla syn. Brassaia actinophylla) of Australia and New Guinea having leaflets radiating from an elongate petiole
